name: Freepto-lb
tagline: Encrypted GNU/Linux OS (based on Debian Wheezy) which can be installed on USB flash drive. Freepto is designed for encrypt your communications (OTR, GPG, SSL), carry your documents in secure way (LUKS) and save your anonymity (TOR, OPENVPN).
body:
## How to build your freepto:

### Chroot Debian Sid

1. Make chroot:

 $ sudo debootstrap --include=debian-keyring,debian-archive-keyring,cryptsetup,live-build,git,ca-certificates --arch i386 sid ~/freepto-lb/

2. User chroot:

 $ sudo chroot ~/freepto-lb /bin/bash

### Using cache for APT (if you use a non-chroot debian sid):

1. Install apt-cacher-ng

 $ apt-get install apt-cacher-ng
 
 $ /etc/init.d/apt-cacher-ng start
 
2. Set http_proxy:
 
 $ export http_proxy=http://localhost:3142/

### Build

1. Make your build.img

 $ git clone https://github.com/AvANa-BBS/freepto-lb.git

 $ cd freepto-lb
 
 $ lb config && lb build
 

### Make Freepto

1. Use "dmesg" to identify the usb device:

 $ dmesg

2. Run makefreepto

 $ bash makefreepto -h

 $ bash makefreepto -i binary.img -p myS3cr3t#luksp4ssw0rd /dev/sdX
 
 
### Read Documentation

 https://we.riseup.net/avana/freepto-docs
 
 http://avana.forteprenestino.net/freepto
